other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient displayed hyperthyrotropinemia at 6 years of age and exhibited elevated TSH levels and decreased FT4 upon re-evaluation at 10 years of age after L-T4 treatment was withdrawn.

other_tests.findings: TSH: 2.61 mIU/L (Normal: 0.27 to 4.2 mIU/L); free thyroxine: 9.52 pmol/L (Normal: 10.9 to 25.7 pmol/L); mild hypothyroidism and absence of antithyroid antibodies.
other_tests.changes_over_time: FT4 levels reached normal ranges (13.77 pmol/L) after starting levo-thyroxine (L-T4) treatment, with suppressed TSH (0.07 mIU/L).

other_tests.procedure_name: Basal PRL, follicle-stimulating hormone, LH, IGF-1, and IGFBP-3 determinations
Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brain
other_tests.findings: Normal size and shape of the pituitary.
